programme.desc: Deed is approached by a woman, Mrs Hussein, who claims that her entire family was wiped out in Iraq by the depleted uranium used by the British in their tank shells. Despite problems in their friendship, and her approaching wedding, Deed persuades Jo Mills to take on Mrs Hussein's case. Meanwhile Deed presides over a case brought by Mrs Bridges, a victim of motor neurone disease, who claims that her terrible illness was caused by the installation of a mobile phone mast on top of her apartment block. programme.title: Cream Reunion at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: They said it would never happen. Cream were one of the best-loved bands of the late 60s, a unique blend of psychedelia, blues, jazz, blues and pop, they lasted little more than two years and 4 studio albums, including the legendary 'Disraeli Gears', and split up after a farewell gig at the Royal Albert Hall in November 1968. Eric Clapton went on to become rock royalty both here and abroad. Bassist Jack Bruce and drummer Ginger Baker have had interesting and varied careers without achieving Eric's commercial success.

programme.title: Cream Reunion at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: They said it would never happen. Cream were one of the best-loved bands of the late 60s, a unique blend of psychedelia, blues, jazz, blues and pop, they lasted little more than two years and 4 studio albums, including the legendary 'Disraeli Gears', and split up after a farewell gig at the Royal Albert Hall in November 1968. Eric Clapton went on to become rock royalty both here and abroad. Bassist Jack Bruce and drummer Ginger Baker have had interesting and varied careers without achieving Eric's commercial success.

programme.desc: Mischievous artist Harry Field, who specialises in preparing bogus coats of arms for gullible American tourists, is bumped off - and Morse takes a personal interest in finding out whodunit. Unfortunately, as investigations progress, he discovers the victim wasn't quite the lovable rogue he initially appeared. John Thaw stars as the Oxford detective, with Kevin Whately, Geraldine James and Freddie Jones.

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp
programme.desc: The quirky comic takes a characteristically surreal look at the week's television, subjecting the latest soap sagas, hottest celebrities and media gossip to his unique brand of scrutiny.

programme.title: Stars in Their Eyes Kids
programme.desc: Cat Deeley hosts this year's search for the talent of tomorrow, featuring soundalikes of flamboyant Scissor Sisters founder Jake Shears, opera star Michael Crawford, Coldplay frontman Chris Martin and UK singers Ms Dynamite and Lucie Silvas.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The remaining seven celebrities perform the Las Vegas-style routines they've been learning for the past week, with coaches Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean watching anxiously to see who will be skating to victory. Viewers have the opportunity to vote for their least favourite dancers at the end of the show, with the results announced at 9.00pm. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant invites another line-up of contestants to have a go at answering 15 questions that could change their lives - with Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice: The Skate Off
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby preside as the two worst couples, as nominated by the judges and viewers, compete to see who will be the next star to leave the show.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires someone has blocked the mountainside water channels on which the new garden will rely, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: Director Roman Polanski's Oscar-winning Holocaust drama based on the true story of Jewish pianist Wladyslaw Szpilman, who survived World War Two thanks to a combination of doggedness and luck. Starring Adrien Brody, Thomas Kretschmann.

programme.title: Quizmania
programme.desc: Late-night interactive quiz strand offering viewers the chance to phone in and take part in all manner of games in the hope of winning big cash prizes.

programme.title: The Hoobs
programme.desc: Groove wants someone to keep him company while he's out collecting.

programme.title: The Hoobs
programme.desc: How can Tula get Groove and Iver's attention when they're playing Hooby Run 'n' Yell?

programme.title: French Football
programme.desc: Round 24 may prove tough for those clubs languishing at the wrong end of the table as Strasbourg host Paris Saint-Germain while Metz travel to Lille.

programme.title: World Cup Skiing
programme.desc: Nick Fellows is in Chamonix, France for the World Cup Skiing magazine shows, previewing this weekend's big race, and presenting ski tips, competitions, profiles and the popular VAST awards.

programme.title: Channel 4 Racing
programme.desc: Turf tips and news from the Channel 4 Racing team.

programme.title: Totally Frank
programme.desc: Charlie's feelings are tested when Trey's behaviour at an industry party leaves her confused about his intentions. Meanwhile, Neve's meeting with Ben, bassist with hot new band The Kicks, could result in a crucial support gig for Frank.

programme.title: Pure T4
programme.desc: Miquita presents Pure T4, bringing viewers the biggest stars, the newest releases and the biggest stories, and counting down the definitive list of the ten hottest things in the world of entertainment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Candy
programme.desc: Monica tries to become friendlier with her neighbours and hangs a basket of homemade sweets on her doorknob.

programme.title: T4: Popworld
programme.desc: It's a very special Popworld this week as Preston from The Ordinary Boys joins Simon and Miquita after his stint in the Big Brother house.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Holiday Armadillo
programme.desc: Ross entertains his son Ben by dressing up as the Holiday Armadillo. Meanwhile, when Phoebe finds out that the repairs are finished on her flat she worries that Rachel prefers living with Joey.

programme.title: Rock School
programme.desc: The first in a new series sees multi-millionaire rock star Gene Simmons, the fire-breathing 'Demon' frontman from legendary rock band Kiss, going back to school.

programme.title: Shipwrecked 2006
programme.desc: New arrival Sam Bush is an instant hit with the Sharks. But will he be impressed by them? They're feeling the pressure since Charlie Murray chose to become a Tiger, and Geoff's exile on the other side of Shark Island is unlikely to persuade Sam to choose Shark life.

programme.title: Channel 4 Racing
programme.desc: Presented by Alastair Down and Mike Cattermole.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Des Lynam and Carol Vorderman host the show in which contestants race against the clock to pit their wits with vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: Supernanny
programme.desc: After working her magic on families in the UK, Supernanny Jo Frost takes her unique approach to parenting to the States. Fred and Andrea Weston are a loving, hardworking family with a big problem: ferocious four-year-old Andrew.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Can one of the 22 players outwit The Dealer and walk away with hundreds of thousands of pounds?

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: Tea with Mussolini
programme.desc: Zefferelli's film stars Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Cher and Lily Tomlin as a loose-knit group of gentile lady ex-pats who haunt the art world and cafes of Florence, oblivious to the rise of Mussolini. The war starts to impinge on their lives and they soon find themselves interned.

programme.title: Sleepy Hollow
programme.desc: Tim Burton's rollicking version of Washington Irving's tale stars Johnny Depp as Constable Ichabod Crane, sent to the tiny village of Sleepy Hollow where a headless horseman is leaving a trail of decapitated bodies. Will his detective skills solve the mystery or is there a supernatural explanation to the murders? Also starring Christina Ricci and Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: The I.T. Crowd
programme.desc: The unloved, ignored, socially-awkward Roy and Moss make up the I.T. department of Reynholm Industries. Their world is shattered by the arrival of a new 'relationship manager', Jen (Katherine Parkinson), a young woman who knows as much about computers as your average 17th-century farmer...

programme.title: The I.T. Crowd
programme.desc: The second of tonight's double bill of writer Graham Linehan's new sitcom, set in an I.T. department.

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Father Jack consumes more floor polish than is good for him and leaves Ted and Dougal half a million pounds in his will. But will he stay dead long enough for them to get it?

programme.title: 4Music: Levi's One to Watch:
programme.desc: From the famous Barfly features performances from the acclaimed Editors, The Kooks and up-and-coming new band Kubichek!

programme.title: 4Music: Soundproof
programme.desc: The Audio Musical Institute examines the connection between deep emotions and great singing.

programme.title: 4Music: 4Play
programme.desc: Exclusive performance and interview with Danish prog rock band Mew.

programme.title: 4Music: 4Play:
programme.desc: On the road with Welsh rockers Bullet for my Valentine.

programme.title: This Sporting Life
programme.desc: Richard Harris turns in a burning performance as the rugby league player who makes good but, in doing so, loses his grip on his relationship with Rachel Roberts, a widow with whom he is having an affair. Written by David Storey and directed by Lindsay Anderson.

programme.title: Wild Things
programme.desc: Tackling fierce climate, remote locations and rugged terrain to bring viewers inside the most compelling stories of the animal kingdom.

programme.title: 30 Minutes
programme.desc: Political commentator Amanda Platell embarks on a personal journey to examine the plight of the have-it-all generation of women today and, in doing so, reflects on her own life choices.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Des Lynam and Carol Vorderman host the show in which contestants race against the clock to pit their wits with vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: Sunrise
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, with Steve Dixon and Paula Fenech.

programme.title: Jay Jay the Jet Plane
programme.desc: Jay Jay embarks on his first solo flight and Tracy begins to find Herky irritating - but soon realises what a good friend he is.

programme.title: The Save-Ums!
programme.desc: The bats don't have enough Valentine's Day cards to send.

programme.title: The Save-Ums!
programme.desc: The ants' coconut shell boat springs a leak.

programme.title: Harry and His Bucket Full of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wins a game he plays with his Nana.

programme.title: Harry and His Bucket Full of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry clones himself in Dino-World so he can do lots of things at once.

programme.title: Franklin
programme.desc: The turtle attempts to become famous through a magazine competition, and anticipates a trip to the circus with his friends.

programme.title: George Shrinks
programme.desc: Becky and George investigate a ghost sighting in the house.

programme.title: Don't Blame the Koalas
programme.desc: Jemma plays a joke on unsuspecting Mark, while Kate is elected class captain - but popularity soon goes to her head.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sinbad
programme.desc: Rongar confronts the man who robbed him of his birthright and is reunited with the sister who betrayed him years before. Fantasy drama, starring Zen Gesner.

programme.title: Blue Water High
programme.desc: Anna struggles to make the grade, and considers going home - until Perri shows her a confidential file that gives her the motivation to stay.

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Jon Bentley, Jason Bradbury and Suzi Perry showcase photo-editing software and look back at the history of Atari. Plus, life without gadgets and the latest MP3 players.

programme.title: World's 20 Best
programme.desc: A team of travel journalists present a countdown of the islands worth hopping, from the crystal clear waters of the Caribbean to the fume-filled fun of Hong Kong and Manhattan.

programme.title: Property Dreams
programme.desc: A couple who have completely redesigned their Victorian house plan to start a new business, as well as adding an extension to their home. With £60,000 to spend, they look into buying a real ale pub or a floating restaurant, both of which have drawbacks. Eventually, they settle on finding a holiday property in the Algarve to rent out, but they're too used to luxury villas, and the money they've raised won't secure anything they'd be willing to live in themselves.

programme.title: Every Which Way But Loose
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Clint Eastwood and Sondra Locke. A bare-knuckle fighter pursues a flighty country singer across the American southwest accompanied by an orang-utan called Clyde.

programme.title: Air Bud: World Pup
programme.desc: Canine sporting comedy starring Kevin Zegers and Dale Midkiff. Bud the golden retriever becomes a top player on the local soccer team.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe is haunted by the ghost of a classmate who was killed in front of her - and is seeking revenge for her untimely death.

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels
programme.desc: Comedy starring Steve Martin and Michael Caine. Competing con-men target gullible ladies on the Côte d'Azur, and battle over a wealthy heiress to see who rules the Riviera.

programme.title: five news and sport
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines and results.

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: First in the second series of the US crime drama. The detectives investigate the death of a skyscraper climber who plummeted from the Empire State Building. Returning to the floor from which he fell, Mac and Flack discover the dead man may have witnessed a murder. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny look into the killing of a fashion designer.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Starting the third series of the US crime drama. The team investigate the death of an ambitious architect who aspired to design the new World Trade Centre - and discover the victim had a silent partner who may have been responsible for his murder.

programme.title: Interview with the Vampire
programme.desc: Gothic horror thriller based on the bestseller by Anne Rice, starring Tom Cruise and Brad Pitt as centuries-old vampires roaming the world in search of fresh prey. With Christian Slater, Antonio Banderas.

programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate the case of a heart surgeon murdered during his son's bar mitzvah, uncovering evidence of Mob connections and a psychiatrist obsessed with the victim's sister.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Manish Bhasin and guests reflect on the week's football issues and action, including a full midweek Premiership programme. This weekend's fixtures include tomorrow's clash at Stamford Bridge, where domestic champions Chelsea face European Cup winners Liverpool.

programme.title: Grandstand: Six Nations Championship
programme.desc: John Inverdale and Craig Doyle introduce the build-up to the first round of matches in this year's Six Nations Championship - Ireland v Italy and England v Wales.

programme.title: Grandstand: Six Nations Championship
programme.desc: Craig Doyle presents live coverage of the Six Nations curtain raiser between Ireland and Italy, kick off at 1.30. The Irish had high hopes of a Grand Slam last season, but came up short and will be looking to launch a fresh assault on the title. Italy have a new coach in the shape of French legend Pierre Berbizier, who will be hoping to bring lead them to their first Test victory in the tournament since March 2004. Commentary comes from Andrew Cotter and Phillip Matthews.

programme.title: Grandstand: Six Nations Championship
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents live coverage of the Six Nations clash between England and holders Wales at Twickenham, kick off at 3.30. The men in red have not won a match at England's fortress home since 1988 and will face a star-studded England side itching to reclaim their position as the best team in the northern hemisphere. Eddie Butler and Brian Moore are the commentators.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: As final whistles sound, Mark Sidebottom brings all the scores and news from the day's matches in NI.

programme.title: Just for Laughs
programme.desc: The hit hidden-camera show returns for a fourth series. A clumsy worker nails his foot to the floor, a portable toilet is suspended 100 feet up and a pretty girl takes an impromptu shower in public.

programme.title: The Sound of Musicals
programme.desc: Les Dennis hosts a celebration of the best songs from the past 75 years of musical theatre. With the aid of backstage interviewer John Barrowman, the team of Jon Lee, David and Carrie Grant, Mica Paris and Ruthie Henshall explain the background and context of the songs they are singing. Includes numbers from Chicago, Sunset Boulevard and The Lion King, plus a guest appearance from boy soprano, Joseph McManners. [S]

programme.title: Sea of Souls
programme.desc: A young man, warned his fiancee will kill him, seeks help but is later found dead. When Craig finds himself falling under the spell of a beautiful stranger he becomes ill and Justine has to delve into ancient Hebrew mythology to discover the true and terrifying nature of what is hunting him and how the young man died. [AD,S]

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights and reaction from the day's eight Premiership matches. With Chelsea not playing Liverpool until tomorrow, the main focus will be on the bottom of the table. Sunderland and Portsmouth face trips to West Ham and Newcastle respectively, while Birmingham host Arsenal and former Manchester United team-mates Bryan Robson and Mark Hughes go head-to-head as West Brom play Blackburn. [S]

programme.title: National Lampoon's Loaded Weapon 1
programme.desc: While trigger-happy, loose cannon, crazy cop Jack Colt mourns the loss of his partner, the case of some cocaine carrying cookies is taxing the talents of the by-the-book, staight-arrow, retiring detective Wes Luger. When the two men collide, watch out - it'll be messy! Spoofing comedies like the 'Lethal Weapon' series, 'Basic Instinct' and 'Silence of the Lambs', this quick-fire film also features some surprise superstar appearances. Directed by Gene Quintano.[S]

programme.title: Animal Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Coinciding with the Winter Olympics, the animal world stages its own spectacular contest. From the makers of the award-winning Animal Games, these new games set real animals against real human Winter Olympic champions. In a special effects extravaganza, animal behaviour is seamlessly blended with record-breaking human Olympic triumphs. Although this winter wonderland is created on computer, all the animals and landscapes are real and the human athletes have been taken from film of their actual gold-winning performances. Featuring animals from all the cold regions of the world and including skiing and tobogganing penguins, reindeer and wolves in a cross-country race and even a skating polar bear - this fact-filled Olympics is like no other. John Motson and Jonathan Pierce commentate "as live".

programme.title: The Virgin Queen
programme.desc: Now in her forties, Elizabeth makes one final fling for marriage - this time to the French Duke of Anjou, who is less than half her age. Meanwhile, Mary Queen of Scots - currently held captive in England - appears to be building allies across Catholic Europe. But Elizabeth's spymaster Francis Walsingham needs proof. After years of surveillance, he ensnares Mary in an elaborate sting to ensure she can be charged with plotting to assassinate the Queen. The trial sparks an international crisis. Elizabeth's advisors urge her to sign the death warrant, but she is all too aware of the terrible consequences. If Mary is executed, the Spanish are ready to exact bloody revenge by unleashing a massive Armada against England. [S]

programme.title: Rail Cops
programme.desc: PC Wendy Coad has to deal with a shoplifter who as stolen a yoghurt from Marks and Spencers and is serenaded by Elvis Presley impersonators at Twickenham Railway Station. She also gets a glimpse of Tony Blair when she clears a station entrance for his arrival. PC Bob Gee and PC Dave Sanders have the task of finding a missing 14-year-old boy. The child, who is on holiday from Canada, is separated from his uncle while on the tube. Trainer Katie Kingston and probationer Mo Shah are called to an incident with an aggressive passenger on a train, and Mo attends his first one under at London Bridge Station. [S]

programme.title: Johnny Cash: the Last Great American...
programme.desc: Johnny Cash sang with Elvis Presley in the 50s, Bob Dylan in the 60s and Bono in the 90s. He died in September 2003 shortly after completing the retrospective 'Unearthed', a 5 CD-set of the acoustic performances with which he resurrected his career in the last decade of his life, and after losing his wife and love of his life, June Carter Cash, in June 2003. This first major retrospective of Cash's life, times and music features contributions from his daughter Rosanne Cash and son John Carter Cash, his longtime manager Lou Robin and fellow musicians including Little Richard, Cowboy Jack Clement, Kris Kristofferson, Merle Haggard and Elvis Costello .Cash was the son of a poor sharecropper from Kingsland, Arkansas, who sang folk, spiritual and country songs to himself while picking cotton in the fields. In the 50s he signed to Sam Phillips' Sun Records, scored his first hits and was part of the 'Million Dollar Quartet' with Elvis, Jerry Lee Lewis and Carl Perkins. In the 60s he created his famous 'Man in Black' persona, and became a huge country star with hits like 'Folsom Prison Blues', 'Ring of Fire', 'I Walk the Line' and 'A Boy Named Sue' while torn between drug dependency, hellraising and a powerful spirituality. Cash had long since established himself as a man of the people with his prison concerts beginning with an incendiary performance in San Quentin in 1958. He ended the decade by finally marrying June Carter, daughter of the legendary Carter Family who helped invent American country music, launching his own national TV series from Nashville, duetting with Bob Dylan, befriending the Native American movement and opposing the war in Vietnam while playing concerts for the soldiers in the field. [AD,S]

programme.desc: Jamie Rickers goes behind the scenes of Disney's latest animated comedy, in which a chicken saves the planet from an alien attack. Including footage of the world premiere in Hollywood and interviews with voice stars Zach Braff, Joan Cusack and Garry Marshall.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter Diaries
programme.desc: Australia Zoo's Crocodile Rescue Unit is called out to capture a rogue croc in the remote South Pacific islands of Vanuatu, where the team try out a new trapping technique. However, the mission looks like failing when Toby is suddenly struck down with malaria. With Steve Irwin.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Comedy with the staff of Grace Brothers on holiday on the Costa Plonka. Starring John Inman, Frank Thornton, Mollie Sugden and Wendy Richard.

programme.title: RTE Sport on Two: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Issy Clarke and Paul King present highlights of the Swedish Rally, the second round of the season on the icy roads of Karlstad, an event unique on the calendar for being the only true snow rally of the 16 scheduled. Marcus Gronholm was victorious in the opening race in Monte Carlo and will be confident of claiming another 10 points having won here three times already.

programme.title: The Golden Lot
programme.desc: Three teams guess the value of the collectibles on show. With a cash prize on offer, the budding antiques dealers must choose between six items, one of which is worth much more than the others. Presented by Carol Vorderman, with expert Charles Bickford. Last in series.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another collection of camcorder calamities, featuring kung-fu crotch kicks and bare-bottomed pensioners. Plus, the chance to Frame a Friend in the search for the nation's funniest practical joke.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: The Dingles discover Cain is on his way back to the village with baby Sarah. However, while Andy is overjoyed, Debbie is horrified and announces that if her daughter is brought home, she'll put her up for adoption. Chastity tries to spend some time with Aaron, but he hits the roof when his dad suggests he stay for a few days.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Rita takes Stacy out for the day, but returns to find her flat has been completely trashed - and there's a further shock in store when Fred begs her not to call the police. Vera learns Tyrone finished his relationship with Maria, and Ed tells Eileen he thinks they have a future together.

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: As Danny considers signing a binding business contract, Sarah is appalled to learn the reserve would have fierce competition in the form of a nearby rival. Evan and Du Plessis accidentally run over a cheetah on the way to buy supplies - but the events of the day pale into insignificance when Olivia is bitten by a snake. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson and Amanda Holden.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: New series of three murder mysteries, starring Geraldine McEwan as the genteel sleuth. A woman experiences an unsettling vision after moving in to the home of her dreams - and it transpires she was brought up in the house as a child. Miss Marple investigates the history of the property and discovers it was connected with a baffling disappearance years before - which has never been solved. With Russ Abbot, Geraldine Chaplin, Phil Davis and Dawn French.

programme.title: Super Bowl XL
programme.desc: Pittsburgh Steelers v Seattle Seahawks (Kick-off 11.20pm). Ford Field in Detroit is the venue as the AFC and NFC champions meet for the 40th hosting of what has become the most watched single sporting event in the world. The Seahawks are aiming to make the most of their first-ever Super Bowl appearance, while the Steelers are looking for a first title since their glory days when they were crowned champions four times between 1975 and 1980. Plus, coverage of the legendary half-time entertainment, which is fronted by the Rolling Stones this year. Presented by Gabby Logan and Gary Imlach.

programme.title: People's Court
programme.desc: More members of the public get the chance to settle disputes by arguing their cases on camera. Legal experts Jerome Lynch and Rhonda Anderson ensure both sides are given a fair hearing, while viewers act as jury. Presented by Carol Smillie.

programme.title: The Hoobs
programme.desc: The Hoobs miss floating on the water in a Hooblebobber. There aren't any Hooblebobbers on the Peep planet, but maybe they can find something that floats in just the same way.

programme.title: The Hoobs
programme.desc: There's a dog outside the Hoobmobile. But why does it keep barking?

programme.title: Transworld Sport
programme.desc: A round-up of sports action from around the globe.

programme.title: World Cup Skiing
programme.desc: Nick Fellows presents coverage of Men's Downhill from the French resort of Chamonix.

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: The compelling teen drama returns to the town of Tree Hill to find Dan in hospital after a heart attack, while Deb contemplates the part she played in putting him there. Peyton and Brooke vow never to let boys come between their friendship, while Lucas and Keith have returned to Charleston to start new lives.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Catch up with all the action in the most exciting teen drama on television.

programme.title: Shipwrecked 2006
programme.desc: New arrival James George spends his first three days on Tiger Island and is left to settle in on his own while the Tigers settle their differences...

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Cheesecakes
programme.desc: Phoebe berates Joey after he cancels a dinner with her for a date. But she soon loses the moral high ground when her ex-boyfriend turns up for one last night of passion before heading back to Russia...

programme.title: The O.C.
programme.desc: Marissa adjusts to life in her new surroundings and makes some new friends at Newport Union, while Ryan wonders how their separation will affect their relationship.

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: When the Replicators threaten to overwhelm the galaxy, taking out the Goa'uld and then Earth, Sam and Thor work to develop a weapon while Jack and Jacob are forced to make an alliance with Ba'al.

programme.title: Star Trek Enterprise
programme.desc: When Archer enters the mirror universe, he mutinies against Captain Forrest in order to capture a future Earth ship found in Tholian space.

programme.title: Scrappy Races Rally
programme.desc: Four teams of scrap-happy bodgers convert their assorted vehicles, using parts scavenged from the Scrapheap, to race across some of the wildest terrain the UK has to offer, carrying out a range of crazy challenges on the way.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Underneath a car park in central Manchester lie the remains of one of the most influential buildings in Britain, a building that transformed the once sleepy town into the cotton capital of the world.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: Desperate Housewives
programme.sub-title: You'll Never Get Away from Me
programme.desc: Bree's mother-in-law, Phyllis, gets her in trouble with the law, Susan tries bravely to accept Edie's new role in Julie's life, Lynette's demanding boss makes her miss Parker's first day of kindergarten, and Gabrielle and John meet again.

programme.title: Invasion
programme.desc: Brand New Series: After finding an old Cuban refugee who says he lost his family to 'the lights', Russell goes fishing to catch one of the mysterious, orange luminescent beings.

programme.title: Rock Schoo
programme.desc: Gene Simmons is in his second week at Kirkley High School in Lowestoft, where the band have just a week to prepare for their first gig.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's multi Oscar-nominated epic stars Daniel Day-Lewis as William Cutting, the leader of a violent gang in 19th-century New York who take on their rivals, led by Liam Neeson.

programme.title: Outside: Coming Up - Snowman
programme.desc: A young black kid on the verge of adulthood is speeding headlong into a spiral of self-destruction.His only hope is a girl called Nasree.

programme.title: The Yonex All England Badminton Championships
programme.desc: Highlights from the world's premier badminton tournament.

programme.title: KOTV
programme.desc: International boxing show with the latest big fight action and news from around the boxing world.

programme.title: French Football
programme.desc: League leaders Lyon host Bordeaux. But can the side from Burgundy put in a vintage performance against the champions?

programme.title: The Jamie Kennedy Experiment
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian and actor Jamie Kennedy hilariously combines sketch comedy with pranks and practical jokes caught on hidden camera.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Des Lynam and Carol Vorderman host the show in which contestants race against the clock to pit their wits with vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: Bagpuss
programme.desc: Emily brings a collection of broken ivory into the shop, prompting Professor Yaffle to tell a story.

programme.title: Monkey Makes
programme.desc: Naomi shows Noodle tidying up can be fun when she teaches him the Calypso Cleaner dance.

programme.title: Rolie Polie Olie
programme.sub-title: Where O Where Did Olie Go?/Gone Doggone Dog/A Chip Off the Young Orb
programme.desc: Dad and Olie are shrunk to a tiny size, while Spot turns into a giant.

programme.title: Jay Jay the Jet Plane
programme.sub-title: Jay Jay Meets the Cloud King/Merit Badge
programme.desc: Herky receives a letter from the Chopper Scouts of America and Jay Jay helps a runaway cloud.

programme.title: The Save-Ums!
programme.desc: Lava World holds a dance marathon - until the music stops.

programme.title: The Save-Ums!
programme.desc: Andre has his tail tickled by something spooky.

programme.title: Harry and His Bucket Full of Dinosaurs
programme.sub-title: I Keep Going Over the Edges
programme.desc: Harry goes to Dino-World so he can make as much mess as he wants.

programme.title: Harry and His Bucket Full of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry goes on the trail of a cookie thief operating in Dino World.

programme.title: Franklin
programme.desc: The turtle creates his own holiday to celebrate the first day of spring, and plays golf with his dad.

programme.title: George Shrinks
programme.sub-title: Journey to the Centre of the Garden
programme.desc: The miniature youngster burrows under the garden in a bid to discover who keeps ruining the family's plants.

programme.title: Snobs
programme.desc: Marian risks his life to win a bet and Pia wonders whether being popular with the Townies is really all that important.

programme.title: Michaela's Wild Challenge
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan measures the world's biggest fangs. Ellie Harrison meets jumping flash-jacks in the Australian Outback and Jamie Crawford discovers the largest wings in North America.

programme.title: Extreme Football Extra
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part compilation of highlights from the series, featuring players past and present taking on a variety of skills challenges. Graeme Le Saux, Ellie Harrison and Dave Payne present.

programme.title: The New Tomorrow
programme.desc: The Ants and Barbs prepare to play ball against the Privs, as a confident Flame declares he will switch sides should the other tribes win. Sky vows to investigate the cave drawings.

programme.title: Arthur's Trip to India
programme.desc: New series. Arthur Duncan and his family pack their bags for a tour of India, beginning in Delhi, where they visit the country's largest mosque and attend a scout ceremony.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Londoner Teoman visits Turkey, where he takes a trip to the Blue Mosque and plays football with children his own age - learning many of them have to work for a living.

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: First in a repeat run of the series where Dr Paul Binski examines Britain's religious art. He begins with two examples of medieval gothic architecture - Winchester Cathedral and Fountains Abbey.

programme.title: five news update
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines, sports news and weather.

programme.title: The Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: Spectacular circus drama from Cecil B DeMille, starring James Stewart, Charlton Heston, Betty Hutton and Cornel Wilde.

programme.title: White Fang 2: The Myth of the White Wolf
programme.desc: Adventure sequel starring Scott Bairstow as a young prospector who teams up with a wolf-dog during the Alaskan gold rush. With Charmaine Craig.

programme.title: five news and sport
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines and results.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter: Collision Course
programme.desc: Comedy adventure starring wildlife expert Steve Irwin as himself. A group of secret agents in the Australian bush are mistaken for crocodile poachers by Steve Irwin and his wife Terri. With Magda Szubanski.

programme.title: Britain's Psychic Challenge
programme.desc: 4 of 7. The five remaining would-be psychics hope to impress the judging panel with their performances in tasks set in a forest and a junk-filled scrapyard. They also diagnose ailments simply by looking at people in a health spa, before one more of them is voted off. Trisha Goddard presents.

programme.desc: Musical starring Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman. A young English writer falls in love with a beautiful actress in 1899 Paris. With Jim Broadbent, John Leguizamo.

programme.desc: A construction worker driving a large digger comes to the aid of police officers during a high-speed pursuit, and an officer dives into a freezing river to save a drowning woman.

programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary highlighting the antics of novice superbike racers battling to win a professional contract with the Virgin Mobile Yamaha Superbike team.

programme.desc: Former Guantanamo Bay prisoner Moazzam Begg joins Max and Mary to talk about faith and freedom. And as 70's supergroup Jethro Tull start a world tour, singer Ian Anderson talks about rock and God. [S]

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Charlotte Smith are in Essex, exploring the stately home at Audley End. Adam Henson investigates plans to resume the export of live farm animals from the UK. Including Weather for the Week Ahead. [S]

programme.title: Grandstand: Six Nations Championship
programme.desc: Jill Douglas is in Edinburgh to present top-class action from the Six Nations Championship. Scotland go into the match looking for their first victory over France at their Murrayfield home for a decade, but their confidence has been rising under new coach Frank Hadden. The French have been touted as pre-tournament favourites after showing signs of returning to their best form during their autumn Test series. Nick Mullins and Jonathan Davies are the commentators, kick-off at 3.00pm.

programme.title: Animal Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Coinciding with the Winter Olympics, the animal world stages its own spectacular contest. From the makers of the award-winning Animal Games, these new games set real animals against real human Winter Olympic champions. In a special effects extravaganza, animal behaviour is seamlessly blended with record-breaking human Olympic triumphs. Although this winter wonderland is created on computer, all the animals and landscapes are real and the human athletes have been taken from film of their actual gold-winning performances. Featuring animals from all the cold regions of the world and including skiing and tobogganing penguins, reindeer and wolves in a cross-country race and even a skating polar bear - this fact-filled Olympics is like no other. John Motson and Jonathan Pierce commentate "as live".

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards meets some Unsung Heroes - extraordinary people of courage and faith, specially nominated by viewers and BBC local radio listeners. He hears the story of the man who has saved twelve lives and meets the family who've got a special surprise for their community. There's music from Matt Redman and Jon Christos and hymns from LSO St Luke's in East London. [S]

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team travel to Londonderry. Under scrutiny are the most intricately produced hand cut pictures, a cache of silver valued at over £100,000 and a cushion woven from human hair. [S]

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: National and international news from the BBC. [S]

programme.title: BBC Newsline

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: The most powerful ability humans have is to master new skills. But how and why do we learn things? What stops us learning? And how can we train our brain to learn better?

programme.title: The Virgin Queen
programme.desc: Now in her forties, Elizabeth makes one final fling for marriage - this time to the French Duke of Anjou, who is less than half her age. Meanwhile, Mary Queen of Scots - currently held captive in England - appears to be building allies across Catholic Europe. But Elizabeth's spymaster Francis Walsingham needs proof. After years of surveillance, he ensnares Mary in an elaborate sting to ensure she can be charged with plotting to assassinate the Queen. The trial sparks an international crisis. Elizabeth's advisors urge her to sign the death warrant, but she is all too aware of the terrible consequences. If Mary is executed, the Spanish are ready to exact bloody revenge by unleashing a massive Armada against England. [S]

Panorama follows the women patients who decided to fight for the right for Herceptin, the new breast cancer ' wonder drug,' and asks - is the healthcare postcode lottery being replaced by who shouts loudest?

programme.title: Animal Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Coinciding with the Winter Olympics, the animal world stages its own spectacular contest. From the makers of the award-winning Animal Games, these new games set real animals against real human Winter Olympic champions. Although this winter wonderland is created on computer, all the animals and landscapes are real and the human athletes have been taken from film of their actual gold-winning performances. programme.title: Rail Cops
programme.desc: PC Wendy Coad has to deal with a shoplifter who as stolen a yoghurt from Marks and Spencers and is serenaded by Elvis Presley impersonators at Twickenham Railway Station. She also gets a glimpse of Tony Blair when she clears a station entrance for his arrival. PC Bob Gee and PC Dave Sanders have the task of finding a missing 14-year-old boy. The child, who is on holiday from Canada, is separated from his uncle while on the tube. Trainer Katie Kingston and probationer Mo Shah are called to an incident with an aggressive passenger on a train, and Mo attends his first one under at London Bridge Station. [S]

programme.title: Johnny Cash: the Last Great American...
programme.desc: Johnny Cash sang with Elvis Presley in the 50s, Bob Dylan in the 60s and Bono in the 90s. He died in September 2003 shortly after completing the retrospective 'Unearthed', a 5 CD-set of the acoustic performances with which he resurrected his career in the last decade of his life, and after losing his wife and love of his life, June Carter Cash, in June 2003. This first major retrospective of Cash's life, times and music features contributions from his daughter Rosanne Cash and son John Carter Cash, his longtime manager Lou Robin and fellow musicians including Little Richard, Cowboy Jack Clement, Kris Kristofferson, Merle Haggard and Elvis Costello .Cash was the son of a poor sharecropper from Kingsland, Arkansas, who sang folk, spiritual and country songs to himself while picking cotton in the fields. In the 50s he signed to Sam Phillips' Sun Records, scored his first hits and was part of the 'Million Dollar Quartet' with Elvis, Jerry Lee Lewis and Carl Perkins. In the 60s he created his famous 'Man in Black' persona, and became a huge country star with hits like 'Folsom Prison Blues', 'Ring of Fire', 'I Walk the Line' and 'A Boy Named Sue' while torn between drug dependency, hellraising and a powerful spirituality. Cash had long since established himself as a man of the people with his prison concerts beginning with an incendiary performance in San Quentin in 1958. He ended the decade by finally marrying June Carter, daughter of the legendary Carter Family who helped invent American country music, launching his own national TV series from Nashville, duetting with Bob Dylan, befriending the Native American movement and opposing the war in Vietnam while playing concerts for the soldiers in the field. [AD,S]

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Einstein's Equation of Life and Death
programme.desc: It is the most famous equation of them all and it made Albert Einstein the most celebrated scientist in history. It explains things of sheer wonder - like why the sun shines and how, after Big Bang, the universe was created. But it also underpins the most destructive force ever unleashed on the planet - the nuclear bomb. This documentary with dramatised elements tells the story of how his most famous discovery, E=MC², went from being a mere set of symbols in a notebook to a weapon of mass destruction. It was something that so haunted Einstein, a lifelong pacifist, that he would describe his involvement in the bomb as his 'biggest blunder'.

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Einstein's Equation of Life and Death
programme.desc: It is the most famous equation of them all and it made Albert Einstein the most celebrated scientist in history. It explains things of sheer wonder - like why the sun shines and how, after Big Bang, the universe was created. But it also underpins the most destructive force ever unleashed on the planet - the nuclear bomb. This documentary with dramatised elements tells the story of how his most famous discovery, E=MC², went from being a mere set of symbols in a notebook to a weapon of mass destruction. It was something that so haunted Einstein, a lifelong pacifist, that he would describe his involvement in the bomb as his 'biggest blunder'.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey wonders if he's in love with Monica. Meanwhile, Phoebe impersonates a police officer.

programme.title: Just Shoot Me
programme.desc: Finch dates a female boxer who has a jealous ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: In the second part of the season finale, Will tries to break the bad news to Grace about Ben cheating on her.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles, under the care of his and Maris's therapist, is convinced that their marriage can be saved; until a surprise rendezvous with his Ice Princess leaves him devastated.

programme.title: Proud Parents
programme.desc: Boxing Olympic silver medal winner Amir Khan still lives at home in Bolton with his parents and has to obey house rules despite being a boxing superstar.

programme.title: Howard Goodall's Twentieth Century Greats
programme.desc: Portrait of Bernard Herrmann - who wrote some of the most famous film music of the 20th century.

programme.title: National Gallery
programme.desc: Featuring key works from the Tate Modern. Age range 14 - 19.

programme.title: The Hustlers
programme.desc: Joel Bravette, 23, got fed up with his accountancy degree and opened a designer bar in Leeds. But when a hardheaded expert tells Joel that he's heading for bankruptcy Joel's got a life-changing decision to make.

programme.title: Re-Writing History
programme.desc: What if women had not been given the right to vote, what if the millennium bug had struck and what if footballers never became millionaires?

programme.title: National Gallery
programme.desc: Featuring key works from the National Gallery. Age range 14 - 19.

programme.title: Rude Britannia
programme.desc: This summer the quiet Staffordshire village of Yarnfield hit the headlines after 11 ASBOs (Anti Social Behaviour Orders) were issued in one swoop.

programme.title: National Gallery
programme.desc: Studies of Marcel Duchamp's Fountain (1917), Michael Craig-Martin's Oak Tree (1973) and Rebecca Horn's Concert for Anarchy (1990). Age range 14-19.

programme.title: The 100 Hottest Web Searches 2005
programme.desc: Entertaining and informative week-long series exploring the stories behind the 100 most searched words on the internet.

programme.title: News at Noon
programme.desc: Includes business news, sport and weather.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Weaver gets into trouble when she agrees to secretly treat the lover of her powerful new patron for syphilis. And Carter tends an unpleasant middle-aged woman - who is slowly being poisoned...

programme.title: Call Northside 777
programme.desc: Tense documentary-style thriller based on a true-life case, starring James Stewart as a Chicago newspaper reporter who doggedly sets out to prove jailed Richard Conte is innocent of murder. With Lee J Cobb and Kasia Orzazewski. Directed by Henry Hathaway.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Des Lynam and Carol Vorderman host the show in which contestants race against the clock to pit their wits with vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal

programme.title: Richard & Judy

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer impulsively buys a snow plough and sets up in business as Mr Plow. But when Barney declares himself the Plow King, their rivalry starts to spiral out of control.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Russ is uncomfortable with the amount of time Sam is spending with Sophie. Then he receives a call that chills him to the bone and threatens to jeopardise everything...

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: 3 Minute Wonder: Squat Street
programme.desc: The third of four short films looking at the last days of London's oldest squatted street. Rosalyn Reid works for The Friends of Kennington Park. She welcomes the demolition of the St Agnes Place squat and the development of the area.

programme.title: Relocation, Relocation
programme.desc: PJ and Hereward Cleghorn-Brown have made a mint on their west London terraced house. But when you're dealing with massive budgets, massive problems have a habit of cropping up...

programme.title: Brat Camp
programme.desc: In this opening episode, seven teenage girls arrive at a leading American wilderness programme for out-of-control teens. For their desperate families, it's a last resort; for the girls, it's the toughest challenge of their lives, and one that could change them forever.

programme.title: Desperate Housewives

programme.title: Madonna Video Exclusive: Sorry

programme.title: The Baby Race

programme.title: Jarvis Cocker's TV Pop Rules!

programme.title: 4Play: Mattafix

programme.title: The Real Patron Saints
programme.desc: Dr Robert Beckford examines the myths and contradictions attached to the patron saints of Great Britain and Ireland.

programme.title: Jewish Law

Sculptor Glynn Williams constructs a scaled-down model of the Sphinx using the tools available in ancient times.

In September 2005 artist Mark Quinn unveiled his enormous statue in Trafalgar square of Alison, pregnant with Parys. Alison has been thrust into the media spotlight as an icon of disability and motherhood, but what is the reality of her and Parys's life together? Presented by Robert Winston. [S]

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents live coverage of the FA Cup fourth round replay between Chelsea and Everton. Extra-time and penalties could be required if another 90 minutes fails to separate these two teams. The winners will book their place in the last 16 as dreams of a place in the 125th final on May 13th suddenly begin to become more real. [S]

programme.title: BBC Ten O'Clock News

programme.title: BBC Wales Special Debate
programme.sub-title: The Battle over the Future of the Arts in Wales
programme.desc: A battle over the arts is raging in Wales. The Welsh Assembly Governement says that it shoulddirectly fund our top arts organisations - fairer funding and less elitism is the promise. The critics though are warning of politicians controlling poets and playwrights. Join Rhun ap Iorwerth for a BBC Wales News Special debate on the way the arts in Wales is run. [S]

programme.title: Stepfamilies
programme.desc: Adrian finds it difficult to get on with his six-year-old stepson Daniel. Suzie Hayman realises that problems in the past are putting a strain on Adrian and his partner Vicky's own relationship. [S]

programme.title: The Fourth Protocol
programme.desc: A renegade KGB General has a chilling plan to destroy the NATO alliance. He has ordered one of his top operatives to enter Britain and assemble and detonate a nuclear device near an American air base. British intelligence agent John Preston uncovers the plan but is in a race against time to get his superiors to believe him, and find the soviet agents. If he fails two thousand people die. Directed by John Mackenzie.[S]

programme.title: A Seaside Parish
programme.desc: The Revd Pat Robson is due in court on a speeding charge, while Matt and Alison face a dilemma over their future together. Boscastle begins an exciting new project to revitalise the harbour.

programme.title: A Passion for Churches
programme.desc: The beautiful church at Orchardleigh has become a favourite destination for couples getting married. But a new vicar is determined to reduce the number of weddings. Has the church become just the ultimate wedding accessory, or are the weddings bringing people back to God?

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: It's Spring in Montana's Rocky Mountains and a Black Bear has just given birth to two tiny cubs. It will take all mother bear's skill, and plenty of luck, if the twins are to survive the summer and learn to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Secret Squirrels
programme.desc: Formby in Merseyside is one of the last remaining strongholds for red squirrels. Their demise over the last century has been rapid, in contrast to the rise of the grey squirrel. The programme reveals how and why Formby has remained a home for our native squirrel at a time when grey squirrels now outnumber reds by more than 60 to one. [S]

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks' family history is rooted in Lancashire; three generations lived in the same street in Rawtenstall and her ancestors form part of the town's cotton weaving heritage.

programme.title: Newsnight

programme.title: Hyperdrive
programme.desc: While hunting for drug smugglers, HMS Camden Lock crosses paths with Clare Winchester, the famous round-the-galaxy solo spacewoman. programme.title: Desi DNA
programme.desc: Why have a group of British Pakistanis decided to put their lives on hold and fly out to Pakistan to help victims of last year's earthquake? Plus a preview of the BBC drama Bangla Nights Banquet.
